Source code for tests.utils.test_ordered_set

"""Tests for the OrderedSet class."""

from typing import Any

import pytest

from moduslam.utils.ordered_set import OrderedSet




[docs]
def test_add():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    assert 1 in os
    assert len(os) == 1






[docs]
def test_add_multiple():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add([1, 2, 3])
    assert 1 in os
    assert 2 in os
    assert 3 in os
    assert len(os) == 3






[docs]
def test_add_non_hashable_exception():
    os = OrderedSet[Any]()
    with pytest.raises(TypeError):
        os.add([1, 2, [3, 4]])  # [3, 4] is not hashable






[docs]
def test_remove():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    os.remove(1)
    assert 1 not in os
    assert len(os) == 0






[docs]
def test_remove_multiple():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add([1, 2, 3])
    os.remove([1, 2])
    assert 1 not in os
    assert 2 not in os
    assert 3 in os
    assert len(os) == 1






[docs]
def test_remove_exception():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    with pytest.raises(KeyError):
        os.remove(2)






[docs]
def test_first():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    os.add(2)
    assert os.first == 1






[docs]
def test_last():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    os.add(2)
    assert os.last == 2






[docs]
def test_items():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    os.add(2)
    assert list(os.items) == [1, 2]






[docs]
def test_len():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    assert len(os) == 1






[docs]
def test_contains():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    assert 1 in os






[docs]
def test_get_item():
    os = OrderedSet[int]()
    os.add(1)
    os.add(2)
    assert os[0] == 1
    assert os[1] == 2






[docs]
def test_ordered_set_equality():
    os1 = OrderedSet[int]()
    os1.add(1)
    os1.add(2)

    os2 = OrderedSet[int]()
    os2.add(1)
    os2.add(2)

    assert os1 == os2

    os2.add(3)
    assert os1 != os2
